New Records: Pakistan chased down a target of 345, setting a new record for the highest successful run chase in Cricket World Cup history, surpassing the previous record of 328 set by Ireland against England in 2011.
Kusal Mendis smashed the fastest century for Sri Lanka in a World Cup match, reaching his century off 65 balls.
Key Match Events: Hasan Ali took 4 wickets for 71 runs.
Haris Rauf picked up 2 wickets for 64 runs in the final over.
Dilshan Madushanka got key wickets in the powerplay, dismissing Imam-ul-Haq and Babar Azam.
Post-Match Reflections: Mohammad Rizwan expressed pride in performing for his country and highlighted the team's belief in chasing the target.
Sri Lanka’s captain, Dasun Shanaka, praised the performances of Mendis and Samarawickrama but noted the need for improvement in bowling and fielding.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Pakistan stretched its Cricket World Cup record against Sri Lanka to 8-0.
Sri Lanka has had bowling problems in the World Cup, also losing their opening game against South Africa, who scored 428 runs against them.
